meanings.definition: To book or reserve in advance.
meanings.sent1: I always prebook my movie tickets to make sure I get good seats.
meanings.sent2: She decided to prebook a table at the restaurant for her birthday dinner.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel prebooked a cozy spot in the tree for the upcoming storm.
meanings.sent4: The students quickly prebooked their study rooms before the exam week.
meanings.sent5: Prebooking your hotel room early can save you money on your vacation.

meanings.definition: The act of booking or reserving in advance.
meanings.sent1: Prebooking for the concert was so popular that tickets sold out within hours.
meanings.sent2: We were glad we did prebooking for the event, as the lines were incredibly long.
meanings.sent3: The prebooking of the meeting room caused confusion among the staff.
meanings.sent4: Her prebooking of the car rental made the trip much smoother.
meanings.sent5: The airline offered a discount for prebooking seats on the flight.
